reviewText: I love this movie and all films of the fantastic director Francisco J. Lombardi. I recommend too: Burnt Money La Ley Del Deseo (Law of Desire) Matador Talk to Her (Hable con Ella) Bad Education (Original Uncut NC-17 Edition) Viva Pedro - The Almodovar Collection (Talk to Her/ Bad Education/ All about My Mother/ Women on the Verge of a Nervous Breakdown/ Live Flesh/ Flower of My Secret / Matador / Law of Desire) Y Tu Mama Tambien Shelter Latter Days (Unrated Edition) Summer Storm

This is a film adaptation of Jaime Bayly's most notorious novel, directed by one of Latin America's most prestigious directors.  Unfortunately, the material itself is weak, dealing as it does with the spoiled lives of the Peruvian upper classes (Bayly is a Vargas Llosa wannabe).  As a result, the characters do not evoke either sympathy nor empathy--particularly the protagonist, played rather innefectively by Santiago Magill (I hated his long hair).  However, the premise happens to be culturally on target: in Per--as in most of Latin America-- it does not matter if you fool aside with men as long as you pass off as straight--meaning a wife, kids, and macho behavior. Thus, as a culture expos and critique, the film is right on target.
Movie arrived in excellent condition and works great!

If you want to kind of undertsand Peruvian society (and the upper class gay members thereof), you can't miss this film. A very bold film for its time but still tasteful...
